description: Single storey rear extension; first floor rear extension including raising ridge height of existing two storey rear outrigger; alteration of existing two storey rear extension roof to raise ridge height; conversion of garage into habitable room including insertion of window in lieu of garage door opening; alterations to the front and rear fenestration including enlargement of openings and replacement of windows; and replacement of main front door; alterations to side fenestration including relocation of openings, new openings and removal of openings; raised rear decking; removal of chimney to west elevation
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings: 0650/S/01 (Location & Block Plan), 0650/S/02 (Existing Survey Drawings 01), 0650/S/03 (Existing Survey Drawings 02), 0650/P/01 REV B (Proposed Ground Floor Plan), 0650/P/02 REV B (Proposed First Floor Plan), 0650/P/03 REV B (Proposed Second Floor Plan), 0650/P/04 REV B (Existing and Proposed Front Garden Elevation), 0650/P/05 REV C (Existing and Proposed Rear Garden Elevation), 0650/P/06 REV C (Existing and Proposed Side Access Elevation), 0650/P/07 REV C (Existing and Proposed Side Garage Elevation) 0650/P/08 REV C (Proposed Roof Plan) and Design and Access Statement for 44 Chatsworth Road produced by Design Solutions (London) Ltd and dated June 2020.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (2016), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | Details of the main front door shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any alterations to the front entrance are commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the development harmonises with the character and appearance of the dwelling and would preserve the special character and appearance of the Hanger Hill (Haymills) Conservation Area, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4 , 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016). | Details of the replacement windows shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced (except ground work) and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The details shall include materials, transoms, glazing and ironmongery. Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the development harmonises with the character and appearance of the dwelling and would preserve the special character and appearance of the Hanger Hill (Haymills) Conservation Area, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4 , 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016). | The hereby approved eight (8) rooflights to the roof slope of the approved development shall be Conservation style rooflights and lie flush with the roof.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016) and policies 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
